alert.note: Alert for Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 15 at 4:39AM PDT until March 17 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 738 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Riverside and San Diego. * WHEN...Until 738 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 439 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oceanside, Carlsbad, Temecula, Vista, Encinitas, Del Mar, Fallbrook, Camp Pendleton, Valley Center and Escondido. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
